poem:
**Anora in the City**

In night's embrace, Ani dances—  
sidewalks whisper tales,  
not of glass slippers,  
but ancient streets holding  
stories of silk and sweat.

Rich brat's shadow long—  
a gilded cage,  
not a castle.

Midnight chimes,  
city pulse quickens,  
love spins chaos,  
the heart—  
never quite obedient  
to its master's clock.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Really speaks to sex workers’: can Anora help humanise a degraded profession? In Anora, a wilful young woman engaged in sex work is swept up in a Cinderella story. Anora, or Ani as everyone calls the titular character, who is played with mercurial force by Mikey Madison, cozies up with a rich young brat (Mark Eidelstein), the spoiled son of a Russian oligarch with mob ties. Their whirlwind romance quickly unleashes clock-strikes-midnight chaos across Manhattan,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
